verses.kjv: And Joseph fell upon his father’s face, and wept upon him, and kissed him.
verses.ct: Joseph threw himself on his father's face, cried over him, and kissed him.

verses.kjv: And Joseph commanded his servants the physicians to embalm his father: and the physicians embalmed Israel.
verses.ct: Joseph ordered the physicians who served him to embalm his father, and the physicians embalmed Israel.

verses.kjv: And forty days were fulfilled for him; for so are fulfilled the days of those which are embalmed: and the Egyptians mourned for him threescore and ten days.
verses.ct: This took forty days, which was the full time required for embalming. The Egyptians mourned for him seventy days.

verses.kjv: And when the days of his mourning were past, Joseph spake unto the house of Pharaoh, saying, If now I have found grace in your eyes, speak, I pray you, in the ears of Pharaoh, saying,
verses.ct: After the period of mourning had ended, Joseph spoke to Pharaoh's household, saying, "If I have found grace in your eyes, please bring this request before Pharaoh:

verses.kjv: My father made me swear, saying, Lo, I die: in my grave which I have digged for me in the land of Canaan, there shalt thou bury me. Now therefore let me go up, I pray thee, and bury my father, and I will come again.
verses.ct: "My father made me swear an oath, saying, 'I am about to die. Bury me in the tomb that I dug for myself in the land of Canaan.' So please let me go up and bury my father, and then I will return."

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh said, Go up, and bury thy father, according as he made thee swear.
verses.ct: Pharaoh replied, "Go and bury your father, just as he made you swear to do."

verses.kjv: And Joseph went up to bury his father: and with him went up all the servants of Pharaoh, the elders of his house, and all the elders of the land of Egypt,
verses.ct: So Joseph traveled up to bury his father. All of Pharaoh's officials, the senior members of his household, and all the elders of Egypt went with him,

verses.kjv: And all the house of Joseph, and his brethren, and his father’s house: only their little ones, and their flocks, and their herds, they left in the land of Goshen.
verses.ct: along with Joseph's entire household, his brothers, and his father's household. Only their young children, their flocks, and their herds remained behind in the land of Goshen.

verses.kjv: And there went up with him both chariots and horsemen: and it was a very great company.
verses.ct: Chariots and horsemen also accompanied him, making it an extremely large procession.

verses.kjv: And they came to the threshingfloor of Atad, which is beyond Jordan, and there they mourned with a great and very sore lamentation: and he made a mourning for his father seven days.
verses.ct: When they arrived at the threshingfloor of Atad, on the other side of the Jordan, they grieved there with intense and bitter weeping. Joseph observed a seven-day mourning period for his father.

verses.kjv: And when the inhabitants of the land, the Canaanites, saw the mourning in the floor of Atad, they said, This is a grievous mourning to the Egyptians: wherefore the name of it was called Abelmizraim, which is beyond Jordan.
verses.ct: When the Canaanites living in that region saw the mourning at the threshingfloor of Atad, they said, "This is a deeply sorrowful occasion for the Egyptians." That is why the place was named Abelmizraim, which is on the other side of the Jordan.

verses.kjv: And his sons did unto him according as he commanded them:
verses.ct: Jacob's sons did exactly what their father had instructed them to do.

verses.kjv: For his sons carried him into the land of Canaan, and buried him in the cave of the field of Machpelah, which Abraham bought with the field for a possession of a buryingplace of Ephron the Hittite, before Mamre.
verses.ct: They carried him to the land of Canaan and buried him in the cave in the field of Machpelah, near Mamre, which Abraham had purchased along with the field from Ephron the Hittite as a burial site.

verses.kjv: And Joseph returned into Egypt, he, and his brethren, and all that went up with him to bury his father, after he had buried his father.
verses.ct: After burying his father, Joseph went back to Egypt, together with his brothers and everyone who had gone up with him for the burial.

verses.kjv: And when Joseph’s brethren saw that their father was dead, they said, Joseph will peradventure hate us, and will certainly requite us all the evil which we did unto him.
verses.ct: Now that their father was dead, Joseph's brothers became afraid. They said, "What if Joseph holds a grudge against us and pays us back for all the wrong we did to him?"

verses.kjv: And they sent a messenger unto Joseph, saying, Thy father did command before he died, saying,
verses.ct: So they sent word to Joseph, saying, "Before your father died, he gave this instruction:

verses.kjv: So shall ye say unto Joseph, Forgive, I pray thee now, the trespass of thy brethren, and their sin; for they did unto thee evil: and now, we pray thee, forgive the trespass of the servants of the God of thy father. And Joseph wept when they spake unto him.
verses.ct: "'Tell Joseph: Please forgive the offense and sin of your brothers, for they treated you badly.' So now, we beg you, forgive the offense of the servants of the God of your father." Joseph cried when he received their message.

verses.kjv: And his brethren also went and fell down before his face; and they said, Behold, we be thy servants.
verses.ct: Then his brothers came in person and bowed down before him. They said, "We are your servants."

verses.kjv: And Joseph said unto them, Fear not: for am I in the place of God?
verses.ct: But Joseph told them, "Do not be afraid. Am I in the place of God?

verses.kjv: But as for you, ye thought evil against me; but God meant it unto good, to bring to pass, as it is this day, to save much people alive.
verses.ct: "You planned to harm me, but God intended it for good, so that what is happening today would come about — the survival of many people.

verses.kjv: Now therefore fear ye not: I will nourish you, and your little ones. And he comforted them, and spake kindly unto them.
verses.ct: "So do not be afraid. I will provide for you and your little ones." He reassured them and spoke to them with kindness.

verses.kjv: And Joseph dwelt in Egypt, he, and his father’s house: and Joseph lived an hundred and ten years.
verses.ct: Joseph remained in Egypt, along with his father's household. He lived a hundred and ten years.

verses.kjv: And Joseph saw Ephraim’s children of the third generation: the children also of Machir the son of Manasseh were brought up upon Joseph’s knees.
verses.ct: Joseph lived to see Ephraim's great-grandchildren. The children of Machir, the son of Manasseh, were also born on Joseph's knees.

verses.kjv: And Joseph said unto his brethren, I die: and God will surely visit you, and bring you out of this land unto the land which he sware to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob.
verses.ct: Joseph told his brothers, "I am about to die, but God will certainly come to you and take you up from this land to the land he promised with an oath to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob."

verses.kjv: And Joseph took an oath of the children of Israel, saying, God will surely visit you, and ye shall carry up my bones from hence.
verses.ct: Then Joseph made the children of Israel swear an oath, saying, "God will certainly come to you, and when he does, you must carry my bones up from this place."

verses.kjv: So Joseph died, being an hundred and ten years old: and they embalmed him, and he was put in a coffin in Egypt.
verses.ct: Joseph died at the age of a hundred and ten. They embalmed him, and he was placed in a coffin in Egypt.
